availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Ashley Carroll Sugg (Union County, Kentucky, postmaster, merchant, and politician)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, postmaster, merchant, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy Bosley Sugg in Union County, Kentucky, in June 1844. Father of Emma C. Sugg, Thomas O. Sugg, and Frank Sugg. Postmaster at Uniontown from May 30, 1849, to September 14, 1852. Merchant in Union County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Merchant in Uniontown in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Union County in 1860. Chairman of the Uniontown Board of Councilmen in Union County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 411 A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film #000562198.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Union County, Kentucky, vol. 14, 732-733.
